entities.name: potters
entities.description: The Potters are mentioned as the Dursleys' sister and her husband. They are described as being 'as unDursleyish as it was possible to be', indicating that they have a different lifestyle and values than the Dursleys.

entities.name: dudley
entities.description: Dudley is mentioned as the son of Mr. and Mrs. Dursley. He is described as someone who should not mix with a child like Harry Potter.

entities.name: mr dursley
entities.description: Mr. Dursley is mentioned as waking up on the day of the story and getting ready for work. He hums while picking out his tie.

entities.name: mrs dursley
entities.description: Mrs. Dursley is mentioned as gossiping away in the morning. She pretends she doesn't have a sister and tries to keep the Potters away from her family.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as the son of Mr. and Mrs. Potter. He is described as someone who should not mix with Dudley.

entities.name: mrs potter
entities.description: Mrs. Potter is mentioned as being the sister of Mrs. Dursley. She has a small son named Harry Potter.

entities.name: potter
entities.description: The Potters are mentioned as having a small son and living in a different lifestyle than the Dursleys.

relationships.description: The Dursleys have a family relationship with the Potters, as Mrs. Dursley is the sister of Mrs. Potter.
Mr. Dursley does not want his son Dudley to mix with Harry Potter, indicating that there is no relationship between them.
